lead_paragraph: Macedonia appeared to step back from renewed civil war today as hundreds of special forces troops left territory that is home to former ethnic Albanian guerrillas. The partial pullout was coupled with the release of 39 Macedonians whom Albanian gunmen had seized in retaliation for the arrests of former insurgents. The moves revived hopes for a peace accord in the former Yugoslav republic.
abstract: Macedonia steps back from renewed civil war as hundreds of special forces troops leave Trebos area, territory that is home to former ethnic Albanian guerrillas; partial pullout is coupled with release of 39 Macedonians whom Albanian gunmen had seized in retaliation (S)
